title: Graham, Morisseau in Northlight Theatre's 43rd season
text:
Graham, Morisseau in Northlight Theatre's 43rd season Bruce Graham Morgan Greene Chicago Tribune 
Northlight Theatre announced its 43rd season Tuesday, featuring a slate of five productions by playwrights familiar to the North Shore company's audience. 
The world premiere of Bruce Graham’s "Sanctions," helmed by artistic director BJ Jones, will open the season. Featuring Mary Beth Fisher, Graham's look at a scandal that blindsides a college football program runs Sept. 14-Oct. 22. 
Continuing the season is Lauren Gunderson's "The Book of Will." Jessica Thebus will direct the play about the creation of Shakespeare's First Folio of plays, playing Nov. 9-Dec. 17. 
Next up is Dominique Morisseau's "Skeleton Crew." Ron OJ Parson will direct the third play in Morisseau's Detroit trilogy, set at an auto plant running on empty at the beginning of the Great Recession. The production runs Jan. 25-March 4. 
Jones will then direct Martin McDonagh’s "The Beauty Queen of Leenane," featuring Kate Fry. The dark comedy about a toxic caretaking relationship runs March 15-April 22. 
Closing out the season is Matthew Lopez's "The Legend of Georgia McBride," about an Elvis-impersonator-turned-drag queen who exchanges his blue suede shoes for high heels. Vanessa Stalling will helm the campy comedy, playing May 10-June 17. 
All performances will take place at the North Shore Center for the Arts, 9501 Skokie Blvd., Skokie.
